confession.seduction_context: When married against her will to Colin Jean Aubert; approached her in garden, promised to get rid of her husband and give her a lot of money

testimony.quarrel_subject: She called him 'coquin' because he was lazy and not as good a manager as his neighbours
Caught her and her daughter stealing nuts in his garden

testimony.threat_quote: Si tu scavois ce que tu doibs rencontrer aux champs si haultz, tu t'en retournerois au logis

witnesses.name: Claudatte femme Colas Jean le Rouyer

testimony.quarrel_subject: Had deposed against her 7 or 8 years earlier
testimony.threat_quote: jamais ne scauroit gré a ladite deposante de ce qu'elle avoit deposé contre elle, quelle beau semblant qu'elle luy face

testimony.quarrel_subject: Her son Gregoire had quarrel with husband of accused when leading animals around his fields
The son of his brother Claude Henry fought with her son and was injured; quarrel followed

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: since rumor of arrest a year earlier

witnesses.name: Claudatte femme du maire Jean Vincent

testimony.threat_quote: que le Diable la puisse aller veoir quand elle seroit en gessine

testimony.quarrel_subject: Quarrel over boy injured in fight
She suspected him of killing 2 of her geese; also quarrel with her husband about family reputations
testimony.threat_quote: il luy en pourroit bien couster de on bien

testimony.quarrel_subject: Husband of accused wanted to hire meadow but her husband refused because he offered too little

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: very soon after quarrel, died within a day
after another quarrel 4 years earlier, ill for a week then slowly recovered

testimony.quarrel_subject: Had quarrel and called her witch

timeline.subject: Barbelline femme Didier Antoine
timeline.details: Confronted with witnesses; no reproaches but denied being witch

timeline.details: Change de Nancy agrees to death sentence

timeline.subject: Barbelline femme Didier Antoine
timeline.details: Sentence carried out at St Dié

torture.requesting_official: procureur for chapter of St Dié

accomplices_named.name: Marguitte veuve Jean Bonipaire
accomplices_named.context: Seen at sabbat; father and mother already executed

accomplices_named.name: Colatte femme Didier Henry
accomplices_named.context: Seen at sabbat; had accused Barbelline

prior_accusations.context: Accused her before his execution a year earlier

notable_quotes.speaker: Jean Charpentier (father of witness 1)
notable_quotes.french: qu'elle en estoit une ou il n'y en avoit point au monde
notable_quotes.english: that she was one [a witch] or there were none in the world

notable_quotes.speaker: Witness 1 (Didier Charpentier)
notable_quotes.french: que pour lors ladite Barbeline faisoit plus de proufit en lait, bure et frommaige, d'une seule vache, que les autres cohabitans ne faisoient avec quatre, jacois qu'on les nourisse autant ou mieux que celles de ladite Barbeline
notable_quotes.english: that at that time the said Barbelline made more profit in milk, butter and cheese from a single cow than other inhabitants made with four, even though they fed them as much or better than those of the said Barbelline
notable_quotes.context: About her boasts of cow productivity

notable_quotes.speaker: Jean (husband's son of accused)
notable_quotes.french: venez veoir au logis, il y a ung rondeau de blanches gens qui dansent
notable_quotes.english: come see at the house, there is a circle of white people dancing
notable_quotes.context: Called people to come see, but nothing was there when they arrived (12 years earlier)

notable_quotes.speaker: Barbelline femme Didier Antoine to Dieudonné Gerard
notable_quotes.french: Si tu scavois ce que tu doibs rencontrer aux champs si haultz, tu t'en retournerois au logis
notable_quotes.english: If you knew what you would meet in the high fields, you would return home
notable_quotes.context: Threatening remark as he passed her house on horse at dusk

notable_quotes.speaker: Vincent Jean le Rouyer to Barbelline
notable_quotes.english: he did not know the way and she should lead them [chickens] there [to the devil] herself
notable_quotes.context: Reply to her threat to send chickens to the devil

notable_quotes.speaker: Barbelline femme Didier Antoine about Claudatte le Rouyer
notable_quotes.french: jamais ne scauroit gré a ladite deposante de ce qu'elle avoit deposé contre elle, quelle beau semblant qu'elle luy face
notable_quotes.english: she would never be grateful to the deponent for what she had deposed against her, whatever good face she showed her
notable_quotes.context: Threat after previous deposition against her

notable_quotes.speaker: Mother of Colin Colas Henry (witness 14)
notable_quotes.french: qu'elle ne mourroit jamais de cette maladie si on ne la tuoit
notable_quotes.english: that she would never die of this illness unless one killed her
notable_quotes.context: Barbelline's statement about the dying woman

notable_quotes.speaker: Barbelline femme Didier Antoine about wife of Vincent le Rouyer
notable_quotes.french: que le Diable la puisse aller veoir quand elle seroit en gessine
notable_quotes.english: that the Devil might go see her when she was in childbirth

notable_quotes.speaker: Jean Gossey
notable_quotes.context: Because she was suspected in all three places she had lived

notable_quotes.speaker: Husband of accused (via witness 23)
notable_quotes.french: il luy en pourroit bien couster de on bien
notable_quotes.english: it could well cost him his wealth
notable_quotes.context: Threat after quarrel about family reputations

notable_quotes.speaker: Claude Anthoine (brother-in-law, via witness 8)
notable_quotes.french: que quand quelcun luy feroit mal que sa femme en tireroit bien la raison
notable_quotes.english: that when someone did him harm his wife would get revenge for it
notable_quotes.context: About accused being able to take revenge

notable_quotes.speaker: Barbelline femme Didier Antoine about Vincent Gerard's arm
notable_quotes.french: et que si dieu vouloit que ledit Vincent aye heu cette maladie, si elle vouloit courir au devant, et comme l'on luy eut enseigné qu'il allast demander du fer en neuf maisons puis en faire ung bras de fer et l'aller offrir a St Lienard aussy tost fut il guery
notable_quotes.english: and that if God willed that the said Vincent had this illness, if she wanted to run ahead, and as they had taught him to ask for iron in nine houses then make an iron arm and go offer it to St Leonard, he was soon cured
notable_quotes.context: Her response about curing Vincent Gerard's bad arm

notable_quotes.speaker: Barbelline femme Didier Antoine
notable_quotes.french: qu'elle renonce bien au diable, mais pour l'esgard de Maitre Persin, elle le laisse pour tel qu'il est, et n'a point veu de mal en luy, partant ne le veult renoncer
notable_quotes.english: that she renounces the devil well, but as for Master Persin, she leaves him for what he is, and has not seen evil in him, therefore does not want to renounce him
notable_quotes.context: Curious reply when asked to renounce the devil and all his power during first interrogation

relationships.person2: Claudatte femme Colas Jean le Rouyer
relationships.evidence_text: Claudatte femme Colas Jean le Rouyer
Reputation 15 or 16 years, since she had come to village

economic_context.details: Quarrel over meadow rental (witness 24); dispute over geese (witness 23); theft of nuts from garden (witness 7). Notable: accused boasted of extraordinary productivity from her cow - made more profit in milk, butter and cheese from one cow than others made with four, leading to suspicions she used illicit means and jealousy from other women who called her 'la profiteresse'.

harms_catalog.harm_description: Lost a bull, a foal, and several pigs

harms_catalog.harm_description: Lost some calves and a foal

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: She told them to stop letting chickens into her garden or send them to the devil; he replied he did not know the way and she should lead them there herself

harms_catalog.harm_description: Became ill same day, died 8 weeks later, always claiming accused was responsible

harms_catalog.harm_description: Died; illness lasted 8 days

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Quarrelled with her husband about family reputations; husband threatened 'il luy en pourroit bien couster de on bien'

harms_catalog.harm_description: Calf died; had to return money to butcher

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Husband of accused wanted to hire meadow but her husband refused because he offered too little

harms_catalog.harm_description: Found dead in stream behind house with cord round neck
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: She bore him 'peu d'amitié' (little affection)

harms_catalog.harm_description: Found dead after 3 weeks with cord round neck and wrists tied together in 2 inches of water
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: He bitterly regretted marriage

Fell ill and died within a day

material_culture.context: Barbelline boasted of extraordinary productivity from her cow
Single cow that produced more than others' four cows
Quarrel over chickens in garden; cock found dead
Accused was making a cake; sent piece that allegedly made recipient ill
In confession: black powder to kill, white powder to cure; money from devil turned to dung
Cure for bad arm: ask for iron in nine houses, make iron arm, offer to St Leonard
Witness riding horse to mill at dusk
First husband thought to have gone to feed oxen before ploughing
Tested powder on hen which died; gave Persin a hen every year to be exempt from sabbat
Witness suspected of killing 2 of her geese
First husband found with cord round neck
Had to return money to butcher when calf died

hearsay_chains.content: Heard them say wife's condition during childbirth was accused's doing

Heard from him at market that she was suspected in native village and all places of residence, so was 'fort meure sorciere'

extraction_metadata.notes: Trial shows pattern of long-standing reputation (up to 30 years) across three different villages (Coinche, Remeymont, Entre-deux-Eaux). Notable features: suspicions about extraordinary cow productivity leading to nickname 'la profiteresse'; familial witchcraft suspicions (mother, father, grandfather); death of first husband under suspicious circumstances; multiple prior accusations from executed witches; characteristic pattern of quarrel followed by harm. Confessed under torture to murders of brother-in-law and Marion veuve Colas Henry, and to causing death of first husband. Curious statement refusing to renounce 'Maitre Persin' during interrogation. Evidence includes both firsthand accounts and substantial hearsay.
